alert.note: Alert for Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 23 at 11:06PM EST until December 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, light snow and blowing snow will continue through the overnight. Additional accumulation 1 to 2 inches. * WHERE...In West Virginia, Western Greenbrier County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 1 PM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan for hazardous road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will continue to remain gusty into the day Saturday.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and strong winds will create dangerously low wind chill values. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow and blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
